revised_title: Quantal Release of Calcium from Subcellular Stores by Inositol Trisphosphate
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cellular and Molecular Neurobiology
tldr: The authors used fluorescence imaging to study the spatial and temporal patterns of subcellular calcium release in Xenopus oocytes induced by photorelease of inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate (InsP3). They discovered that InsP3-sensitive calcium stores are arranged as distinct and functionally independent units, and that calcium release can occur in both graded and regenerative fashions. This research provides insights into the complex organization of calcium liberation and its role in signal transduction pathways.
